pullRequest.title: CB-5254: Add ability to reboot a single FreeIPA instance.
pullRequest.bodyText:
This patch adds the APIs and flows to support requesting
a reboot of a single instance of a FreeIPA cluster.

nodes.bodyText: throw an error here
throw an error here

Stringbuilder is overkill here I think. I know there is some class where it's implemented that way, but I don't think that's a good pattern. Also inherited classes should include super.toString() or we can loose useful data
extra empty line
maybe @NotEmpty is better here
if we need these comments please convert this into a javadoc for the method
please move into a validate method
why do we start a new flow for every instance? I think we should start 1 flow with all the instance IDs which we would like to restart.

something definitely wrong here, you use the payload.getResourceId() for fetching the stack and the instance. It should be the stack, and I would rewrite this to fetch all instancemetadata you need. And if you need the instanceMetadata in only 1 flow step, maybe you should fetch it only in that step.
if the instance.get() failes here is pretty strange, I think we should fail earlier
please add instanceids to the log, makes investigation easier
stream usage seems reasonable here
also a log for changing the status. and unit test please
please replace AVAILABLE string with the actual value
I think something is wrong here. You used the heath to filter what to log, but you don't use it to filter. In my opinion peek should just log and don't have any logic at all, this could be misleading

similarly as in the other log, I don't think having logic in peek is a good idea, or at least move out the logic, so it's not duplicated. If somebody touches the filter and not the logit logic it will differ

it's misleading you don't return health if it's forced. you should ignore health where you filter for instances to restart if it's forced, but this method doesn't exactly do what you expect by it's name
could you rename the variable? like allInstanceByInstanceId, because I had to lookup the code to know what is in this map
it looks like only 1 instance scenario is tested, I think more complex cases needs to be tested
where is this used?

nodes.bodyText:
ok, so it's still a bit confusing here, so let me explain what I would do:

InstanceEvent would contain stackId as resourceId as you need that to create the cloudcreadentials etc
InstanceEvent would contain a set of instanceIds selected for reboot
I would use findAllInStack for fetching instancemetadatas and filter in a stream, or have a separate repository query which contains stackId and instanceids too. Shouldn't make a big difference as freeipa won't have hundreds of instances
You have to decide what happens if one/more/all instancemetadata is missing. I think this should not happen as it had been validated earlier, but maybe you should fail the flow with a message so it would be obvious that something is pretty wrong. Maybe you let in the force flag here and restart anyway the found instances and just log an error in that case
if you really need these cloud stuff and real instancemetadata here then this override should be ok, so we wont make unnecessary db load for other steps.
as this step is getting a big one, maybe you should move it a separate file
if we send this event the restart will begin, but if we kill that service which is running this flow another will pick up from here and will send the reboot command again. Is it ok?
please use an else here, so the indentation would reflect a logic too

so we could say here if(instanceIds.size() != validInstanceIds.size()) and just calculate the difference of the 2 collection and log at once and add it to the message.
this way the for could be a stream:
Collection<String> validInstanceIds = instanceIds.stream().filter(allInstances.contains).collect()
and you could drop the badIds flag
